original_solution_mapping.L1: Jenny is older than Charlie by 5 years who is older than Bobby by 3 years, so Jenny is older than Bobby by 5+3 = <<8=8>>8 years
original_solution_mapping.L2: Jenny will be twice as old as Bobby when he is 8*2 = 16 years old
original_solution_mapping.L3: Jenny is 5 years older than Charlie so when Jenny is 16, Charlie will be 16-5 = 11 years old

original_function_code:
def solve():
    """Index: 7235.
    Returns: Charlie's age when Jenny becomes twice as old as Bobby.
    """
    # L1
    jenny_older_than_charlie_years = 5 # Jenny is older than Charlie by five years
    charlie_older_than_bobby_years = 3 # Charlie is older than Bobby by three years
    jenny_older_than_bobby_years = jenny_older_than_charlie_years + charlie_older_than_bobby_years

    # L2
    twice_factor = 2 # twice as old
    # Based on J = B + jenny_older_than_bobby_years and J = twice_factor * B,
    # we deduce B = jenny_older_than_bobby_years.
    bobby_age_at_that_point = jenny_older_than_bobby_years
    jenny_age_at_that_point = bobby_age_at_that_point * twice_factor

    # L3
    charlie_age_at_that_point = jenny_age_at_that_point - jenny_older_than_charlie_years

    # FA
    answer = charlie_age_at_that_point
    return answer

logical_steps.solution_line_template: Jenny is older than Charlie by {jenny_older_than_charlie_years} years who is older than Bobby by {charlie_older_than_bobby_years} years, so Jenny is older than Bobby by {jenny_older_than_charlie_years}+{charlie_older_than_bobby_years} = <<{jenny_older_than_bobby_years}={jenny_older_than_bobby_years}>>{jenny_older_than_bobby_years} years
Jenny will be twice as old as Bobby when he is {bobby_age_at_that_point}*{twice_factor} = <<{bobby_age_at_that_point}*{twice_factor}={jenny_age_at_that_point}>>{jenny_age_at_that_point} years old

Jenny is {jenny_older_than_charlie_years} years older than Charlie so when Jenny is {jenny_age_at_that_point}, Charlie will be {jenny_age_at_that_point}-{jenny_older_than_charlie_years} = <<{jenny_age_at_that_point}-{jenny_older_than_charlie_years}={charlie_age_at_that_point}>>{charlie_age_at_that_point} years old

flawed_nl_reconstruction.L1: Jenny is older than Charlie by 5 years who is older than Bobby by 3 years, so Jenny is older than Bobby by 5+3 = <<8=8>>8 years
flawed_nl_reconstruction.L2: Jenny will be twice as old as Bobby when he is 3*2 = <<3*2=6>>6 years old
flawed_nl_reconstruction.L3: Jenny is 5 years older than Charlie so when Jenny is 6, Charlie will be 6-5 = <<6-5=1>>1 years old

explanation: Incorrect operand. The variable 'charlie_older_than_bobby_years' (value: 3) was used instead of 'bobby_age_at_that_point' (value: 8).
